meanings.sent1: He bulled his way through the crowd to get to the front.
meanings.sent2: The football player bulled past the defenders to score a touchdown.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy bulled its way to the food bowl, eager to eat.
meanings.sent4: The storm bulled through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant bulled through the sand to reach its anthill.

meanings.sent1: The train bulled down the tracks, picking up speed.
meanings.sent2: The bulldozer bulled through the rubble, clearing the way.
meanings.sent3: The excited child bulled ahead of the group on the nature hike.
meanings.sent4: The river bulled past the rocks, carving a new path.
meanings.sent5: The wind bulled through the trees, causing the leaves to rustle.

meanings.sent1: He bulled about his achievements, trying to impress everyone.
meanings.sent2: The politician bulled during the debate, making grand promises.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman bulled about the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent4: Her words bulled through the air, full of exaggeration and lies.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller bulled his way through the tale, adding more drama than truth.
